item.title: William add a quote by Lenny Bruce
item.description: "The 'what should be' never did exist, but people keep trying to live up to it. There is no 'what should be,' there is only what is." -- Lenny Bruce

item.title: William add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: William add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: William add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: William add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: William add a quote by Lenny Bruce
item.description: "There are never enough 'I love you's." -- Lenny Bruce

item.title: William add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "To you, I'm an atheist. To God, I'm the loyal opposition." -- Woody Allen

item.title: William add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Is sex dirty? Only when it's being done right." -- Woody Allen

item.title: William add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Sex is the most fun you can have without laughing." -- Woody Allen

item.title: William add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Love is the answer, but while you are waiting for the answer, sex raises some pretty good questions." -- Woody Allen

item.title: William add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "More than any other time in history, mankind faces a crossroads. One path leads to despair and utter hopelessness. The other, to total extinction. Let us pray we have the wisdom to choose correctly." -- Woody Allen

item.title: William add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Men learn to love the woman they are attracted to. Women learn to become attracted to the man they fall in love with." -- Woody Allen

item.title: William add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "What if everything is an illusion and nothing exists? In that case, I definitely overpaid for my carpet." -- Woody Allen

item.title: William add a quote by Mary Gaitskill
item.description: "He had lunch with Cecilia that afternoon. They ate their corned beef on rye and cream cheese with lox in a diner peopled by waiters who looked like theyÂ´d met with utter disappointment and become attached to it." -- Mary Gaitskill

item.title: William add a quote by Mary Gaitskill
item.description: "When John took those naked pictures, the most popular singer was a girl with a tiny stick body and a large deferential head, who sang in a delicious lilt of white lace and promises and longing to be close. When she shut herself up in her closet and starved herself to death, people were shocked. But starvation was in her voice all along. That was the poignancy of it. A sweet voice locked in a dark place, but focused entirely on the tiny strip of light coming under the door. I drop the rag in the bucket and smoke some more, ashing into the sink,. A tiny piece of the movie from the naked time plays on my eyeball: A psychotic killer is blowing up amusement parks. At the head of the crowd clamoring to ride the roller coaster is a slim, lovely man with long blond hair and floppy clothes and big, beautiful eyes fixed on a tiny strip of light that only he can see." -- Mary Gaitskill

item.title: William add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I don't want to go to heaven. None of my friends are there." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: William add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Women are meant to be loved, not to be understood." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: William add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The very essence of romance is uncertainty." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: William add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "With freedom, books, flowers, and the moon, who could not be happy?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: William add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If you are not long, I will wait for you all my life." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: William add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Never love anyone who treats you like you're ordinary." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: William add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You are more to me than any of them has any idea; you are the atmosphere of beauty through which I see life; you are the incarnation of all lovely things...I think of you day and night. ~ Letter to Lord Alfred 'Bosie' Douglas" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: William add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "Marriage is not a process for prolonging the life of love, sir. It merely mummifies its corpse." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: William add a quote by P. G. Wodehouse
item.description: "Woman is the unfathomable, incalculable mystery, the problem that we men can never hope to solve." -- P. G. Wodehouse

item.title: William add a quote by P.G.Wodehouse
item.description: "She had more curves than a scenic railway" -- P.G.Wodehouse

item.title: William add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "Joan was nothing more than a friend. He was not in love with her. One does not fall in love with a girl whom one has met only three times. One is attracted, yes; but one does not fall in love. A moment's reflection enabled him to diagnose his sensations correctly. This odd impulse to leap across the compartment and kiss Joan was not love. It was merely the natural desire of a good-hearted young man to be decently chummy with his species." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: William add a quote by Neil deGrasse Tyson
item.description: "The good thing about science is that it's true whether or not you believe in it." -- Neil deGrasse Tyson

item.title: William add a quote by Neil deGrasse Tyson
item.description: "Recognize that the very molecules that make up your body, the atoms that construct the molecules, are traceable to the crucibles that were once the centers of high mass stars that exploded their chemically rich guts into the galaxy, enriching pristine gas clouds with the chemistry of life. So that we are all connected to each other biologically, to the earth chemically and to the rest of the universe atomically. Thatâs kinda cool! That makes me smile and I actually feel quite large at the end of that. Itâs not that we are better than the universe, we are part of the universe. We are in the universe and the universe is in us." -- Neil deGrasse Tyson

item.title: William add a quote by Neil deGrasse Tyson
item.description: "The more I learn about the universe, the less convinced I am that there's any sort of benevolent force that has anything to do with it, at all." -- Neil deGrasse Tyson

item.title: William add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "At the age of eleven or thereabouts women acquire a poise and an ability to handle difficult situations which a man, if he is lucky, manages to achieve somewhere in the later seventies." -- P.G. Wodehouse
